channel.title: [Delta]Noob Question:What does this code do?
channel.description:
Now I never really use different forms of this code, yet I would like to know what this stuff means. Its globalobjects and heres is the code [code] makeGlobalObject(X-Cord, Y-Cord, ObjID, 0, 10);[/code]
Now I just don't now what the 0 or 10 does...I'm trying to create a thieving skill and I'm going to add stalls and wonder how the 0 and 10 effects the stalls
Sorry deathschaos9 for posting it in server tuts didn't realized where I was until you moved it

item.title: [Delta]Noob Question:What does this code do?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

The 0 goes from 0-3 depending on what direction you want your object, North, South, East, or West.
As for the 10 this just determines the type of object, wall, floor, ceiling, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta]Noob Question:What does this code do?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“MrFun, post:3, topic:464367”][quote author=lostmyphat link=topic=568292.msg4126112#msg4126112 date=1350429118]
0 is facin direction dont mess with the 10
[/quote]
so the “0” goes from 0-4? or what?[/quote]
0-3 I believe.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta]Noob Question:What does this code do?
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

lostmyphat:

0 is facin direction dont mess with the 10

NVM my stuff is this for the 0
0=South
1=west
2=North
3=East
Facing directions, but thanks for the help

Read full topic
